data.title: Flyboy
data.text: The Best and the food and service was excellent.  The nearest P.F. Chang's is 120 miles from where I live so when I am near one on business I make it a point to stop. I am never disappointed at P.F. Chang's

data.title: Lunch meeting
data.text:
If you like modern Chinese restaurant with a great atmosphere this is the place to go. 
P.F. Chang is a chain restaurant and provides consistent food. It’s a great place for lunch, dinner with friends and family or business meetings. They have a full bar and very clean and modern atmosphere. 
I have visited this restaurant more than a dozen times and they have never failed in providing great service and delicious food.  This restaurant is on the second floor of Paseo Colorado and has convenient parking in the garage and easy access to the second floor. You can be seated inside or outside with a partial view of the City or Colorado Blvd.

data.title: yummy food / great location
data.text:
I love this restaurants food and it was centrally located....just steps from
where we were going.  service was very good.   a bit tricky to find since
it's in a walking mall.  but it's upstairs and the sign can be seen.   I love
all P.F. Chang restaurants.

data.title: Wonderful service by Devon
data.text: We wanted a light lunch and received the most wonderful service and food. Devon was over the top kind, informative, and delightful! Thanks for a lovely afternoon in Pasadena!

data.title: Live up to the name!
data.text: We always enjoy dinner at P.F Chang's every time we visit Los Angeles. This time we drove around 30 minute from down town just to have dinner here. Love lettuce wraps , fri calamari, beef with broccoli. This time I try pad Thai (describe as street food in Bangkok) it's good but not great. The service is very good. We didn't wait long for food to be served. Parking is convenient down stair.

data.title: once a visit
data.text:
I always stop by at least once each visit to Pasadena. It's a nice place to go with co-workers, food is good, beer is cold.
However, place can get hot, need to crank the AC a little better

data.title: Good Asian Fusion
data.text: My favorite plate is the salt and pepper shrimp with the low-mien noodles. Also had the beef and broccoli, spicy chicken and chicken fried rice. We had very good service I think her name was Melissa.

data.title: Salt, with a side of soy?
data.text: I don't understand why the crowds keep flocking to this chain, especially in California, where there are so many other really good Chinese food options! The menu reads great, but the flavor of anything is overwhelmingly dominated by salt, salt, and more salt. So keep drinking the tea and water, and choose a place that is not marketed to a typical American palate.

data.title: Great Night Well Managed
data.text: Turned up on the spur of the moment with very large group they managed us superbly. Paced service just right and nothing was cold our lacked taste. It's a chain but they still made it feel unique.

data.title: My first time and we got incredible service
data.text: I went with someone who is a fan of the chain.  I ordered a mild version of the spicy chicken, my friend ordered the spicy shrimp.  We got spring rolls and an order of stir fry egg plant.  Our male waiter came back and said after thinking about my not wanting hot spicy food, maybe I would rather have mild lemon chicken instead of spicy chicken.  My friend got her spicy shrimp with the hot red chili peppers on the side.  The order was perfect, and he checked several times to be sure we were happy.  The restaurant in the Paseo was clean, staff efficient, food excellent so I will go back.  It was also a perfectly sunny day about 75 degrees and the outside patio was lovely.  On the second floor above the shoppers in the Plaza, quiet elegant place for lunch.

data.title: Just what you'd expect
data.text: I had lunch at this location.  I've eaten at PF Chang's before in other locations.  It's not the most authentic experience but the food was good and the service was excellent.  I always feel like the food is slightly overpriced and the portions are a little too modest and that was my experience this time, too.

data.title: Not up to usual standard of the chain
data.text: Food was ok but service poor largely, due to the apparent shortage of staff. Some starters arriving 10 mins after the majority had eaten theirs. Two mains arrived after the majority had finished. Service around the table slow from an inexperienced waiter and when a more senior member was asked to chase the kitchen up he was less than helpful. Would not rush back.

data.title: Good service at lunch time
data.text: Ate lunch there with a friend.  Service was good and our food quite tasty.  She received a huge tureen of soup and the other portions were all okay.

data.title: Good place for a business lunch
data.text: Food os ok. Nice decor. Brought a team there for lunch. Received good service but waited long for the food to come out.

data.title: I love PF Changs
data.text: This one did not quite hit the mark though.  I have had pad thai in a few PF Changs and I absolutely loved it.  I had it here and it just wasn't as good.  Also the prices were way too high for a simple Chinese.  As I recall most of the course were $15 + which for a chain is steep in my opinion.

data.title: Not what I remember
data.text:
I have not been to PF Changs in a few years, I was so looking forward to eating there. Unfortunately my experience did not match up with my memories. I even asked my friend if she felt the same or if it was me. We both agreed they used to serve rice with the lettuce wraps and mix a special sauce for you. Maybe they have done away with these two items. We did feel the Ahi salad was tasty and were happy with our beverages. 

The service was okay. You should not have to ask for silverware or the check. Maybe we caught PF Changs on a bad day.

data.title: Tasty sushi at PF Changs - who knew
data.text: I didn't even know PF Changs serves sushi. I was pleasantly surprised that it was indeed tasty. We had two different sushi rolls (dynamite shrimp, and tuna). We also had green beans, and asparagus which were cooked to perfection - the sauce was so good you may be tempted to lick the plate. Haha. Definitely coming back

data.title: Crowded night, quick seating
data.text: On the night I went there was a festival so the place was packed.  I was given a table quickly and a waiter was instantaneously.  The food is fresh and well prepared.  Although there was nor than I could eat it is reasonably priced.  I never felt rushed but always attended too.  Great place for a family as well.

data.title: Disappointing
data.text: I hope we hit P F Chang's Pasadena on a bad day for them.  The hot and sour soup had the consistency of wet glue and the Mongolian lamb was swimming in oil. No problem with the tea

data.title: Not so great
data.text: I was travelling for work and staying at the Sheraton next door. I ordered a new item, lobster over fried rice. Caught my attention right away, sounded delicious. The menu states "wok seared lobster" . What I was served was breaded, deep fried lobster. Very greasy, french fry quality, a great way to ruin a fantastic shellfish. My server was awesome, asked if I could be served something else, I declined because I grew up being taught not eating what you are served is a sin.( I know thats silly, just something I am stuck with) I asked to talk with the manager, she came out listened to my complaint, went to the kitchen and never returned. Really gross new addition. Unbelievable that it would be described one way on the menu and served so different. French fry vs. baked potato kind of thing.
